answers.answer: I would suggest you make an appointment with a cardio doc.  Grade one means very minor, but suggest you visit a specialist to determine how to keep it from becoming a serious matter.  Keep us informed.

question: I recently had an echocardiogram and the finding showed Grade 1 diastolic dysfunction.  I was told I didn't need to do anything.  Is this true?  I do not have high blood pressure or diabetes.  Do I need to follow up with a cardiologist?  I am a 65 year old white female.Thank you
title: Echocardiogram
